item.description: Physical Rescue; INC#1163; 03:30PM; 19500 W Ventura Bl; MAP: https://bit.ly/3hKLfPV; Tarzana; Two-vehicle collision, involving a pedestrian. Minor injuries to one driver. Pedestrian was pulled from under vehicle prior to extrication tools being deployed, and transported to a local trauma center in serious condition. No building involvement (vehicle stopped short of hitting the structure). Nothing further. LAPD Inc 2742.; FS 93; Batt 17; Valley Bureau; Council District 3; BC17 E273 E73 E83 E84 E93 EM17 HR3 RA73 RA84 RA903 T73 UR88; CH8; 17; Nicholas Prange

KNOCKDOWN Structure Fire; INC#1053; 02:49PM; 517 S San Julian St; MAP: https://bit.ly/3pKnvzT; Downtown; Firefighters located a fire on the third floor (of the four-story hotel built in 1925), being held in check by fire sprinklers. It took 48 firefighters 16 minutes to extinguish the flames. Two patients have been located and firefighter-paramedics will assess the need for treatment and transport (unknown age/gender/condition/affiliation). Cause under investigation.; FS 9; Batt 1; Central Bureau; Council District 14; BC1 BC11 E203 E209 E210 E3 E4 E9 RA25 RA803 RA809 SQ21 T10 T3 T9; CH9; 13; Nicholas Prange

Structure Fire; INC#1053; 02:33PM; 517 S San Julian St; MAP: https://bit.ly/3pKnvzT; Downtown; Four-story pre-1933 center-hallway hotel with smoke showing. Offensive mode.; FS 9; Batt 1; Central Bureau; Council District 14; BC1 BC11 E203 E209 E210 E3 E4 E9 RA25 RA803 RA809 SQ21 T10 T3 T9; CH9; 13; Nicholas Prange

Brush Fire; INC#0734; 11:37AM; EB 118 Fwy x Rocky Peak Rd; MAP: https://bit.ly/36NVi10; Ventura County; LAFD responding in automatic aid to a one-quarter-acre brush fire in Ventura County (LA Co FD also responding). For more information on this incident, please monitor Ventura County FD channels. Nothing further.; FS 96; Batt 15; Valley Bureau; Council District outside city; AO1 AO2 BC15 BC17 E106 E107 E28 E290 E296 E305 E73 E8 E84 E90 EM15 H1 H2 H3 HA1 HA2 HA3 RA96 T105 T90 T96; CH5; 17; Nicholas Prange

KNOCKDOWN Structure Fire; INC#0238; 05:31AM; 5235 N Vantage Av; MAP: https://bit.ly/3HPeknR; Valley Village; Thirty-two LAFD firefighters performed a coordinated attack between interior fire attack and rooftop ventilation to extinguish the flames in 23 minutes. No reported injuries. Cause under investigation.; FS 60; Batt 14; Valley Bureau; Council District 2; BC14 E102 E260 E278 E289 E60 E86 RA60 RA860 T60 T78 T89; CH9; 17; Nicholas Prange

Structure Fire; INC#0238; 05:08AM; 5235 N Vantage Av; MAP: https://bit.ly/3HPeknR; Valley Village; One-story single-family home with fire showing. Offensive mode.; FS 60; Batt 14; Valley Bureau; Council District 2; BC14 E102 E260 E278 E289 E60 E86 RA60 RA860 T60 T78 T89; CH9; 17; Nicholas Prange

Update Hiker Rescue; INC#0575; 11:20AM; 2600 N Westridge Rd; MAP: https://bit.ly/3vF1Tc1; Brentwood; Rescuers have safely hoisted the patient and transported via air ambulance to a local trauma center. Nothing further.; FS 19; Batt 9; West Bureau; Council District 11; AO1 AO2 BC9 BP19 E19 E237 H1 H5 HA1 HA5 RA37 RH114 T37; CH7; 13; Nicholas Prange

Hiker Rescue; INC#0575; 10:39AM; 2600 N Westridge Rd; MAP: https://bit.ly/3vF1Tc1; Brentwood; Firefighter-paramedics have located an injured mountain bike rider in a remote area, and are preparing for a hoist operation.; FS 19; Batt 9; West Bureau; Council District 11; AO1 AO2 BC9 BP19 E19 E237 H1 H5 HA1 HA5 RA37 RH114 T37; CH7; 13; Nicholas Prange

Update Hiker Rescue; INC#1006; 05:27PM; 3032 Runyon Canyon Rd; MAP: https://bit.ly/3vI78Yb; Hollywood Hills West; Urban search and rescue specialists/firefighters rescued both mother, daughter, and canine from the steep slope near Runyon Canyon Road. We are pleased to report no illness or injury was discovered upon evaluation by firefighter-paramedics. Nothing further.; FS 41; Batt 5; West Bureau; Council District 4; AO1 BC5 E227 E290 E41 E82 H1 H5 HA1 HA5 RA41 RH114 T27 T90; CH7; 13; Nicholas Prange

Hiker Rescue; INC#1006; 03:47PM; 3032 Runyon Canyon Rd; MAP: https://bit.ly/3vI78Yb; Hollywood Hills West; LAFD has located two females (one adult/one juvenille) with a canine stranded mid slope, unable to return to trail or road. Crews set up a two-line rope system and have sent two rescuers down to make contact and create a rescue plan.; FS 41; Batt 5; West Bureau; Council District 4; AO1 BC5 E227 E290 E41 E82 H1 H5 HA1 HA5 RA41 RH114 T27 T90; CH7; 13; Nicholas Prange
